benchmark_details.name: JailBreakV-28K
benchmark_details.overview: JailBreakV-28K is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate the transferability of LLM jailbreak attacks to MLLMs and assess the robustness and safety of MLLMs against diverse jailbreak attacks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate whether techniques that successfully jailbreak Large Language Models (LLMs) can effectively jailbreak Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) and evaluate their robustness against various jailbreak attacks.

data.source: Generated from a combination of pre-existing datasets and newly curated malicious queries.
data.annotation: Manual annotation and synthesis of malicious queries.

methodology.calculation: ASR is defined as the number of successful jailbreak attempts divided by the total number of attempts.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ASR indicates a greater vulnerability of the MLLMs to jailbreak attacks.
methodology.baseline_results: The average ASR of jailbreak prompts across various models revealed significant vulnerabilities.
methodology.validation: Evaluation of the ASR across 10 different MLLMs against the JailBreakV-28K dataset.
